alert.note: Alert for Coke; Irion; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 1:36AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coke, southern Sterling, Tom Green and Irion Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 134 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms from northern Coke County, south into northwestern Tom Green County, and northern Irion County, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Angelo, Robert Lee, Mertzon, Bronte, Wall, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Grape Creek, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Veribest, Sanco, Knickerbocker, Arden, Vancourt, Lake Nasworthy, Tankersley, Orient, San Angelo State Park, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Water Valley and Sherwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
